Translations.Text: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
and by the self - reproaching soul
Does man think We are unable to assemble his bones? But indeed We are, even after they have been scattered or reduced to dust
But also each finger tip with its mark or prints We will be able to reconstruct
Indeed, impudent is he who has no shame of his sins
and in positive unbelief he asks as to when is that alleged Day of Resurrection
Then when the sight is dazed by terror and fright
and the moon is eclipsed and reflects no light
and the sun and the moon lose orbit and draw together in one mass and go out of shape
Shall man wonder as to which way to turn in order to have recourse to a shelter as a means of escape
But never; there is no shelter to recourse to
For now to Allah, your Creator, does the one - way journey proceed
There and then shall man be informed of all the good he had done and the evil he committed and of all he had neglected or omitted

Each one shall be his own witness, and his deeds shall be a witness of his worth. He knows exactly all that he had done and he also knows if he had perverted best things to worst abuse or to their meanest use
and of no import shall be his excuse
Do not rush O Muhammad to speak, but hold your tongue and listen to what the Angel relates
We are responsible for imprinting it in your heart and impressing it on your mind, and We are responsible for its compilation and for its perusal
When We read it to you, you follow its intonation
We are responsible for its interpretation
No, but you people value only the life here which is evanescent and ephemeral not lasting and faster than arrows
You ignore the great momentous Hereafter
There and then some faces shall feature radiant countenance expressive of deeply felt joy
derived from the countenance of Allah their Creator, c1othing their souls with the comely vesture of virtue and innocence, as a feature of the visible radiance of the divine
Other faces will be expressive of gloom and dismay
Expecting the calamity of the heavy debt to Allah which they will have to pay
No, but when the death - rattle is impending and it is time for the soul to part
and a hopeless effort is being made in search of a healer to restore his soul
But it is concluded that death is impending and he is to depart
Now both legs are laid across each other in preparation
For a one - way journey; and to Allah his Creator is the destination
No, but he was never disposed to benevolence nor did he engage in the act of worship
But he had refused to acknowledge the divine message and closed his heart's ears to the truth
and among his people he walked upon air and exercised self – conceit
So now, it serves you right
Indeed it serves you right
Does man think he could do what he will and act without restriction or limitation and neglect his duties and his obligations to Allah, and get away with it
Was he not a Notfa (sperm) in a seminal fluid that is emitted

Then by union with its counterpart it became Notfa Amshag* "zygote" which developed into a clinging organism. Then Allah has given it form and shape, proportions and a constitution ensuring that the individual is not alone human, but unique - from the pattern of the finger prints to the number, colour, shape and length of the eyelashes, - ref. Human Embryology M.j.T.Fitz Gerald M.D., London
and from this male seed "sperm" did He make the two sex divisions of organic beings the male and the female
Absolute as He is, Will He not be able to raise the dead when all creation is His
Was there not an era when man was not even heard of

We created man from the product of the union of two Notfas "sex cells" Notfa Amshag "Zygot" with the surest standard by which to test his tendency, and We endowed him with the gifts of hearing and vision, faculties divine
We guided him and conducted him to the right way which We ordained to be the course of life and conduct, and left him to choose to be grateful or to deviate from what is just and right
We have prepared for those who deny Allah chains, yokes and blazing Fire
But the righteous shall enjoy a drink with the distinctive fragrance and the distinguished savour of "kafoor" which excites relish and affords delight
Streaming from a source reserved especially for those who served Allah Whose object was the heart of their purpose and to Him, they lifted their inward sight
Those who kept their vows and feared a Day whose evil is far-reaching

For the love of Allah, they fed the indigent, the orphan and the captive, (believers or unbelievers), in spite of their attachment to the object they offer, thereby setting a good example and an excellent guide

Their true and hidden motive as expressed in words to those in need has always been : "We supply you with the necessities for the sake of Allah and the enjoyment induced". "We expect nothing in return, not even your gratitude
We dread Allah's righteous indignation on an endless drastically distressful Day
Consequently has Allah ensured them immunity from the evil of that Day and shall inspire them with lightened eyes and radiant countenance expressive of deeply felt joy
For their patience, there await them the abode in bliss and the exquisite silken attire
Reclining on thrones, they do not suffer the heat of the sun nor experience the bitter thrust of the cold, only the divine warmth to which they aspire
Enjoying themselves under delightful foliage afforded by trees whose fruits excellently adorn, as with blazonry, the branches springing up and down to be always within easy reach
They are served by handsome attendants for the table, where the food is dished in silver utensils, and the drinks in vessels of exquisite transparency
Vessels of translucent silver, like to the glorious sun’s transparent beams, whose extent has been prescribed to satisfy individual needs
They are served with drinks flavoured with zanjabeel of paradisiacal quality and splendour

Streaming from a fountain named Salsabeel, a name descriptive of its features of beauty, solemnity and the grandeur of its course and its flux; features causing the colours and the flow to blend in a music of tranquility
